result.execSummary:
The defendant David N. Schwartz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with Huber privileges.   IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.    
**NOTE:  Defendant's attorney was court appointed and a wage assignment was put into effect and shall continue in effect until the Clerk of Courts Office is reimbursed in full for attorney's fees and costs. 
**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
--------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
--------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No violent contact with victim.
--------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
--------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
--------------------------------

timeConds.notes: to commence on or before 09/19/2016 at 8:00 a.m. and with work release privileges.

AMENDMENT 3-18-2016: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH P.A.D.S. DEFENDANT MUST CONTINUE COUNSELING

AMENDMENT 12-07-15 CASH BOND ADJUSTED DOWN TO $2500.00
AMENDMENT 11-16-15 NO CONTACT WITH F.M. AND DEFENDANT MAY NOT ENTER ANY BARS OR LIQUOR STORES.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH P.A.D.S. OR 1215 W YODER LANE, WHITEWATER.   If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
